snippet.title: Valparaíso: City of Fires, Earthquakes
snippet.description: Porteños, as locals are known, have lived through fires and earthquakes for centuries. Today, the city is being savaged by a fire that has already killed 11 people and left thousands without a home. read »

snippet.title: Chile Earthquake Leaves European Southern Observatory (ESO) Telescopes Undamaged
snippet.description: Chile’s major northern astronomical observatories escaped damage from the Magnitude 8.2 earthquake that struck Tuesday off the country's northern coast, the European Southern Observatory (ESO) reported. “There was no damage whatsoever last night,” ESO astronomer emeritus Massimo Tarenghi told Forbes.com by phone from the observatory's Santiago [...] read »

snippet.title: MLS Playoff Picture: Timbers Take Slight Lead In Supporters' Shield Race, Union And Earthquakes Battle Elimination
snippet.description: An already wild MLS season that saw the league’s worst team win the hundredth incarnation of the US Open Cup just keeps getting wilder. The results of the last week have seen a team that will likely miss the MLS Cup playoffs win the hotly contested Cascadia Cup with only [...] read »

snippet.title: Tremors In Ohio Attributed To Shale Drilling
snippet.description: A series of small earthquakes on Monday brought shale gas drilling to a standstill in Mahoning County, Ohio and reinforced concerns about the seismic consequences of hydraulic fracturing. The National Earthquake Information Center of the U.S. Geological Survey recorded four earthquakes with magnitudes over 2.2 on the Richter scale, including a [...] read »

snippet.title: Copper Rises After Chilean Quake; Gains Muted On Lack Of Mine Damage So Far
snippet.description: (Kitco News) - Copper prices are higher Wednesday after a giant earthquake struck off the coast of Chile, the world’s largest producer, Tuesday night. Some are describing the gains as muted so far, however, in the absence of news reports detailing any major supply disruptions. Newswires are reporting that a number [...] read »

snippet.title: Drone On, Travel Marketers
snippet.description: VideoIn the immediate aftermath of the last major Mexican earthquake, our Mexico tourism client pleaded with us to help counter the U.S. media's overly dramatic reports that the entire country was destroyed. In fact, the damage was isolated to just a few areas, and most of the big resort destinations [...] read »

snippet.title: Seismologists Convicted In Earthquake Case
snippet.description: Well, I was just wondering the other day what if anything had ever happened with that case in Italy where seismologists were charged with manslaughter—manslaughter!— for telling people not to worry too much about an earthquake (which then happened). Turns out the Italian court did the right thing and dismissed [...] read »

snippet.title: The Goldilocks Dilemma: Too Much Cybersecurity Or Too Little?
snippet.description: Cybersecurity continues to be a hot topic these days, but it’s unclear whether CIOs are doing too much or too little to tackle the problem. Sometimes it seems as though enterprises are developing the same attitude about breaches that Californians have about earthquakes – sure, we’re vulnerable, but what are [...] read »

snippet.title: Can You Sue A Robot For Defamation?
snippet.description: Life moves pretty fast. Especially for journalists. When an earthquake aftershock shakes America's second largest city, news outlets scramble to be the first to cover the story. Today the news itself made news when various outlets picked up on a curious byline over at the Los Angeles Times: "this post [...] read »

snippet.title: Japan - Big Earthquake In Semiconductor Country
snippet.description: The following is excerpted from an Objective Analysis Alert e-mailed to our clients eight hours earlier. An earthquake of magnitude 7.3 struck today, Friday December 7, at 5:18 PM roughly 300km off the coast of Japan's main island, Honshu. The earthquake caused a 1-meter high tsunami, but is said not to [...] read »
